result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin Elaine Burch

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Becker. arc   e: Atty Harrelson

10:30 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for RMW, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Fox, Defendant Erin Elaine Burch appeared by  video.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Erin Elaine Burch.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes an INFO is not filed at this time.  INFO will mirror the complaint. Court proceeds to ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Reserves on speedy trial. Atty Harrelson will not be representing def by next court hearing. Adjourned at 10:36 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:14 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  Defendant Erin Elaine Burch in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Erin Elaine Burch. Defendant Peter Michael Gulich Jr. in court.  Attorney Aaron James Morrison Esq in court for Peter Michael Gulich Jr.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.    INCLUDES: 22CF517 & 22CF516    Attys agree to call cases together for the Preliminary Hearing only.  State calls SCCO Deputy Aaron Praschak.  Witness sworn. State direct.  Witness identifies DE Peter Gulich.  Witness identifies DE Erin Burch.  Atty Harrelson cross.  Atty Morrison cross.  Witness excused.  Argument by Atty Morrison.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court confirms addresses.  Bonds continue.  Adjourned: 2:50
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Continuance Request for 8/18/22 Preliminary Hearing; filed by DA. Per TCH, approved. Court finds good cause to continue exists. to be rescheduled with Commissioner. gll
with attachment. Signed by RMW 8/1/22.  gll

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Justice Support Services. Reviewed during INIT. bph

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.A.F. or A.K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant to comply with any TPC disposition orders or protective plans regarding children.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:39 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA: Michael Becker  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today  Defendant Erin Elaine Burch appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets PH with Court Commissioner. Adjourned at 1:45 PM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
